title: Edith Grossman, eminent translator of Spanish literature, dies at 87
description: She made the marvels of Cervantes and Gabriel García Márquez available to English readers and championed translation as an art form in its own right.

title: What are depleted uranium rounds, and why is U.S. sending them to Ukraine?
description: The U.S. has used depleted uranium munitions for decades and no law bans them, but they remain controversial and have been linked to potential health effects.

title: Extreme rain in Hong Kong turns city streets into raging rivers
description: A record 158.1 mm of rain fell in Hong Kong between 11 p.m. and midnight, the most in an hour since records began in 1884.

title: Prigozhin confidant says fatal plane crash shows no one is safe
description: Maksim Shugalei’s comments showed the still-simmering anger and cynicism among pro-war Russian nationalists over the Wagner Group leader’s death.

title: The scene in southern Brazil after flooding from cyclone kills dozens
description: At least 39 people have died in southern Brazil this week as an extratropical cyclone — a powerful storm that has flooded the state of Rio Grande do Sul, lashed dozens of cities and left more than 3,000 people homeless.

title: King Charles’s first year: How he handled power, money and his family
description: A year since Charles III ascended to the throne — on Sept. 8, 2022 — a majority of Brits say he is doing a good job, though he’s not as popular as his mum was.

title: Prison escapes are hard to pull off. How did these fugitives do it?
description: Convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante “crab-walked” over a prison wall, while terror suspect Daniel Abed Khalife reportedly hid under a van. Both methods are unusual.

title: 1,000-year-old mummy with long brown hair unearthed in Peru
description: “This is an adult individual in a sitting position,” archaeologist Mirella Ganoza said of the mummy, believed to belong to the Ychsma people, found in Lima.

title: Chinese memes make U.S. envoy unwitting brand ambassador for new Huawei phone
description: Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo, whose job includes export controls on exporting chips to China, has been featured in memes promoting Huawei’s new hi-tech phone.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia decries U.S. plan to supply Kyiv with depleted uranium rounds
description: The plan to send the controversial munitions, which can pierce armor and are mildly radioactive, is an escalation in the type of U.S.-supplied weapons to Kyiv.

title: Five key findings from The Post’s investigation of match-fixing in tennis
description: A Post investigation of match-fixing in tennis is based on dozens of interviews with with players, coaches, investigators, tennis officials and match fixers

title: In northeast Ukraine, the Russians are coming – or maybe setting a diversion
description: Russian troops are pushing toward Kupyansk in the Kharkiv region, perhaps trying to seize the city liberated by Ukraine a year ago or maybe to redirect Ukrainian forces from the south.

title: The unraveling: How a small-town police officer took down the largest match-fixing ring in tennis
description: Strange betting patterns on tennis tournaments led a dogged Belgian police investigator to one of the biggest match fixing rings in sports history.

title: The maestro: The man who built the biggest match-fixing ring in tennis
description: Grigor Sargsyan built a tennis match-fixing empire, preying on pros in the lower ranks who struggle to earn a living from the sport.

title: The G-20 summit is a huge global branding exercise for Modi’s India
description: Under Indian leader Narendra Modi, the typically staid diplomatic summit is going to be a full pomp affair.

title: Women win Mexican primaries; one is likely to be first female president
description: It’s not quite Barbie Land, but Mexico has become a world leader in gender parity in government.

title: Mexican court expands access to abortion, even as U.S. restricts it
description: Wednesday’s unanimous Supreme Court decision will require Mexico’s federal hospitals and clinics to offer abortion.
